title.narrative: Electricity Access (Rural) Expansion Project Phase II

description.narrative: The development objective of the Second Phase of the Electricity Access Rural Expansion Project for Ethiopia is to establish a sustainable program for expanding access to electricity in rural communities, thus supporting broad-based economic development and helping alleviate poverty. This restructuring will bring the following changes: (a) institutional arrangements informed by assessments of Ethiopian electric power (EEP's) fiduciary and procurement capacity; (b) disbursement arrangements; and (c) legal agreements. Specifically, the financing agreement will need to be revised and new project (between the Bank and EEP) and subsidiary (between the Government of Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia (GoE) and EEP) agreements drafted.

condition.narrative: Borrower to contribute funding (including the proceeds of the IDA credit) to EEPCo for not less tha 80 percent o the capital costso f the grid-electrification component of the project.
ESMF & RPF implemented in manner satisfactory to IDA
GoE to provide a summary note describing composition, roles, responsibilities, & governance mechanisms for the Committee on grid&off-grid electrification; also key coord. & integration processes.

Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 3, the Recipient shall cause the Financial Statements of EEPCo for the period fromJuly8, 2013 to be audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the General Conditions. The audited FinancialStatements for this period shall be furnished to the Association not later than June 9, 2014.

The Project Implementing Entity shall, at all times during Project Implementation maintain the UEAP Office, with competent staffinadequate numbers, qualifications & experience satisfactory to the Association with responsibility for implementing the grid-basedrural electrification program under Parts 1 and 3(a) of the Project.
